metadata.description: Wright's Law learning curves for clean energy technologies
metadata.methodology: Cost declines by learning_rate fraction for each doubling of cumulative capacity
sources: Oxford Martin School - Way et al. 2022 'Empirically grounded technology forecasts'
metadata.notes: Learning rates represent historical cost decline per doubling of cumulative deployment. Floor costs represent theoretical minimums based on materials and manufacturing.

solar_pv.description: 27% cost reduction per doubling - held consistently for 50 years
solar_pv.source: Oxford Martin School - 50 year historical data (1976-2024)
solar_pv.notes: Most reliable learning curve in energy. Includes module + BOS + installation.

solar_pv_module_only.description: Module-only learning rate (slightly higher than system)

wind_onshore.notes: Slower learning than solar due to mechanical complexity and materials intensity

wind_offshore.description: 10% cost reduction per doubling - earlier on learning curve
wind_offshore.notes: Still early stage, learning rate may accelerate with floating offshore

lithium_ion_batteries.description: 18% cost reduction per doubling of cumulative GWh
lithium_ion_batteries.notes: Pack-level costs. Cell-level floor ~$30/kWh. Includes LFP and NMC chemistries.

sodium_ion_batteries.description: 20% learning rate - early stage but proven chemistry
sodium_ion_batteries.notes: Lower energy density but no lithium/cobalt. Good for stationary storage.

heat_pumps.notes: Includes air-source and ground-source. COP improvements tracked separately.

electrolyzers_pem.description: 18% cost reduction per doubling - similar to batteries
electrolyzers_pem.notes: PEM technology. Very early on learning curve - high uncertainty but strong potential.

fuel_cells_pem.notes: Transportation fuel cells. Stationary has different economics.

evs_battery_pack.description: Same as lithium-ion - battery is dominant cost component

nuclear_smr.description: 5% learning rate - limited by regulatory and construction complexity
nuclear_smr.notes: Very early stage. Learning rate highly uncertain. Could accelerate with factory production.

conservative.description: Apply learning curves but with floor costs and no breakthroughs
conservative.notes: Floor costs are 20% higher to account for unforeseen challenges

solar_2010_to_2024.notes: Learning curve predicted 87% decline, actual was 89% - slightly conservative
